alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 10:17PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Alleghany and northeastern Ashe Counties in northwestern North Carolina, central Smyth and southwestern Grayson Counties in southwestern Virginia through 1045 PM EDT... At 1017 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Thomas Bridge, or near Sugar Grove, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marion... Chilhowie... Jefferson... Lansing... Mouth Of Wilson... Mount Rogers National Recreation Area... and Sugar Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
